Reviews.Title: “Please do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHREYA B
Reviews.Content: After my trip to Singapore and Malaysia, I would say, "Everything about the tour was very good except the hotel in Singapore. It was pathetic." I had a horrible experience and I have decided never to use it again and would not recommend it to anyone. The rooms were at the New wing yet, very shabby. Room service was horrible were even a cup of tea was not served before 1.5 hrs. The staff behaviour was rude and they were not at all helpful. Dining Hall was dingy and breakfast was in unhygienic manner. I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MattAussie
Reviews.Content: Had A fairly good stay at this hotel I booked through their website online which made it easier...... http://www.grandchancellorsingapore.com/ if you want to book their it gives me a good price. I was happy with the location of the hotel in "Little India" A place that has more of a culture to it i feel then the rest of the places i visited in Singapore. Not the best hotel in Singapore of course but one I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: stirl0
Reviews.Content: This was not a hotel I chose for myself. As a consequence of Singapore Airlines changing my flight from Taipei I missed my connecting flight and so was provided with this hotel for my one night (enforced) stopover. The hotel does, of course, have existing negative feedback and I can only concur with much of what has already been said. It really is fairly dreadful and unless you have compelling reasons for wanting to stay in this part of town I would recommend you avoid it. Incidentally, I will be taking up as a separate matter, with Singapore Airlines, why they use this hotel and having been inconvenienced by the change in flight schedules they should deem it fit to use such a poor hotel. If you are on a Singapore Stopover holiday I would suggest you look at other properties....there are so many good hotels in Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Aussieguyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Little India which is one of the worst places to stay in Singapore. It is definitely the dirtiest part of the country. It is not a good place for a female to stay. 99% of the population and Indian males and on Sunday nights it seems like thousands of them just stand around the streets. It is a very uncomfortable atmosphere for any female. Internet is not free as advertised. In fact it is very overpriced. Best to got to Starbucks or McDonald for free internet. Tipping is normally discouraged in Singapore but staff at this hotel expect it and wait for it with their hand extended. Reception staff give the bare minimum of service and were not very helpful. Nor is any information given to guests about facilities at the hotel. Although there were 3 of us in the room we were only supplied with 1 door card. As this is needed for accessing the lift, entering the room and power in the room it was very inconvenient if we were not all together. Eventually we managed to get a second one. Convenient to get to the Little India MRT station for getting out of the area. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “value for money but bad location.”
Reviews.Author: punitadatta3
Reviews.Content: Booked a three bedded room in this hotel thru asiatravel.com. Since the rates were economical and the hotel looked quite impressive on the net, I went ahead and paid the full amount for 8 nights stay in advance. Small details were missing : the agent is given one block which is 'podium' - no frills and fancies. no breakfast included. tea/coffee making machine is provided but no coffee or tea sachets. no cutlery whatsoever. When we requested for some cutlery, the answer was 'no'. There were no mirrors in the room except for one small mirror above the washbasin. It can be a real pain to a woman :) I had to tip-toe to the lift (shining steel door of the lift acts as a mirror) to check out my new dress before leaving for a party. The tower block is given to group bookings. And the worst part was the location. The little (south) india area is the worst area in Singapore. On a sunday evening, labour class men in thousands come and gather there.. and just ogle at women passer-bys .. can be a real nuisance !! Would not recommend this hotel unless you are a business traveller with a budget, you go to your room only to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL GRAND CHANCELLOR (LITTLE INDIA)”
Reviews.Author: sreee
Reviews.Content: This definitely was one of the worst hotels I have been to in my entire life. I am person who travels quite a lot officially and for pleasure trips.So I guess I am eligible to comment on such hopeless hotels. Me and my family were there for 4 days.They treat customers like as if we are beggars.The hotel reception is more like a market place and they employ a lot of trainees at the reception(u cannot blame trainees for being slow) who find it difficult responding to our queries. Morning complementary breakfasts were one of the worst I have had. They were unable to provide sufficient quantity of all items even.Their orange juice was mostly water and no juice ! At times even the bread stock ran out.Then they blame it on too many people being accommodated ! The rooms were satisfactory. But the bathrooms were terrible.They do not clean it properly. Even the closets do not have an attached Ablution faucet which I have never seen in my life. Water bottles are not provided in room service. Their lift systems are way beyond user friendly. Every family is provided with ONLY "1 CARD" which has to be used for entering the room, lift ! So if one of the members decides to hang out longer and comes back late he has to call one of his family members all the way down to go back to the room which is very disgusting ! During that time duration the rest of the family will be in darkness in the room.! I WOULD STRICTLY ASK EVERYBODY TO AVOID THIS HOTEL WHAT SO EVER ! There are plenty of hotels in Singapore !So there is nothing to worry that way !

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: escaflownie
Reviews.Content: If you're NOT an INDIAN, you may not like this hotel. Very poor service, rude staff. That's all I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; exercise patience with the service”
Reviews.Author: SMorovich
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel during a layover on the way to India. Service was REAL slow to get checked-in, but once done, didn't have many issues. Rooms: Clean, neat. A little on the small side, but not cramped. Showers had no partition, which was a little annoying but not enough to stop me from bathing. Service: Terribly slow during check-in, but helpful after that. Kept my bags secured after check-out while on a tour. Location: In little India, walking distance from the Hawker center. Not bad, but far away from standard tourist areas like Raffle's Hotel, Merlion Park, Singapore Flyer or Marina Bay. (About 8 dollar taxi ride away.)

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Hotel, but less in service”
Reviews.Author: Sentaries
Reviews.Content: Near MRT Little India (less than 5 minutes), Many Indians Foods, Near Mustafa (you can walk), clean hotel, only less in services (thanks God we meet Irvan, Room service who has Indonesian father :) thank you irvan)

Reviews.Title: “Podium Block Room”
Reviews.Author: luckymurali
Reviews.Content: Horrible is an understatement to describe the service of this hotel. They look down upon Indians and treat us like untouchables. Avoid this hotel at all cost. The room is decent in size and comfort but bathrooms are terribly designed and the entire bathroom will become wet if you take a shower. There is no shower curtain or door to the shower area. There is an electric kettle but no coffee / tea mixes. It can be used to take only hot water. House keeping will take its own sweet time to attend to your request... even if it is a simple request of a towel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: JamesCalmwater
Reviews.Content: Extremely rude staff, poor house keeping. The rooms were decent. But the house keeping doesnt even bother to change sheets every few days. Do not stay here... This hptel might be located close to the city, but not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: kjwatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was organized by Singapore Airlines and I was not paying for it, but had I paid, I would have left. The airport shuttle service was good, but beyond that it was not pleasant. The hotel is located in little India, which is not the best place in Singapore, when leaving the hotel it has an abundance of Indian restaurants but that was it. The reception staff were not particularily helpful, and the hotel lift is noisy and you can here it's recording system from inside the room. When taking our bags to the elevator on departure, a staff member stepped over our bags and jumped in the lift before us, without offering any assistance and we had to wait for another elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Going down hill fast....”
Reviews.Author: flick501
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times now but this last trip is the last trip! Room was disgustingly dirty marks and spills all over the walls, very moldy slow draining shower which even had a dirty brown tide line. Disgusting! I am now developing tinea too! The noise was incredible with out of control guests making noise in corridors at all hours. The bed was so hard and linen a bit suspect. Staff were generally rude with no customer service skills and the older Indian duty manager guy had a shocking attitude. Staff would push past you when u were waiting for lifts not hold doors open and plainly rude when asking for an extra key as two of us were in the room. there was some food spilt on the floor in the hall by our room that stayed there the entire duration of our 3 day stay. I first stayed here in mid 2010 when it first opened and this place has gone down hill since.... Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel not a complete value for money.”
Reviews.Author: vishnu_sable
Reviews.Content: I felt good while booking through web, but the actual services or the room size not up to marks. General behaviour and approach of staff was not welcoming rather it was arrogant most of times. The cleanliness was OK, breakfast was OK, swimming pool is Good but open only for limited time. The location is OK. Hotel expects 1 hour early checkout which for me resulted in hurry for my family, and a slight delay of about 5-10 mins. resulted in ambarasment due to staff behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “please avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mehtahiral
Reviews.Content: through all the local travel agents and some online offer, it seemed like this was a good choice... but mark me, it is not!! first, the good - 1. close to little india, eateries and metro. 2. reasonably clean hotel 3. one particular semi senior executive who was chiniese faced (sorry i wish i could remember your name and mention it) was a nice a really helpful gentleman. the bad - 1. The really loud and long temple bell ringing i atleast twice a day 2. too many indian travel agents seem to have propogaed this hotel. The lobby at the time of check in and what it remained pretty much all the time, showed that seriously they were not able to handle the crowd. you either need to throw attitude, money or boast an agent link. No genuine request can find its way other wise. 3. breakfast was off too fast. it was cold. and so were the people. When we requested for hot milk to be actually hot, the waiters said it is not their responsibility that the hot milk remains hot!! huh what was that!! 4. we had a corner room so having more glass panes and openness to the outside climate fluctuations. the ac didnt seem to have handles the pressure. my father had two days of fever and i too got night fever. The repair staff in private acknowledged it but admitted that they couldnt do anything. they didnt even guide us for a doctor. we called the senior and the seniors senior and who not. They all said that yes something was wrong but didnt know what! we had a 6 day long stay out of which finally the last two days they shifted us to another room. 5. staff truly rude and uncooperative. theyll either say yes and never do it or give useless attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slayer2689
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good but other than that I don't think anything else is good about the place. The staff is vey rude and the bell boys simply are not doing their duty. I don't even want to talk about the food the hotel has to offer, it is terribly cooked and totally bland in taste. All in all worst hotel in singapore! Totally not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fair enough but can be better”
Reviews.Author: Didit Y
Reviews.Content: I agree a hundred percent with most of the reviews I read just now about the hotel staff attitude. A male staff on duty when we checked in was not friendly at all..in fact bordering on arrogant. The other female staff was at first friendly but when questioned about why we still could not check in at 4 pm (one hour after check-in time), she showed signs of arrogance too. I needed a lot of patience to keep my cool. I booked and fully paid our hotel room about 2 weeks before arrival date, but when we got there, they could not even give us a room number, much less inform us what time we could check in. Their check out time is 12 noon. That's more than enough time to clean the rooms for the next occupant. But we had to wait another 4 hours for us to check in. It is also true that the room is basically bare of essential food like - coffee, tea, drinks or snacks which you usually find in hotels upon check in. Drinking water? Bring your own. Hotel lay-out? The Podium Block is an extension of the main hotel - acceptable. But they locked the main lobby entrance on the ground floor and so guests have to make a roundabout thru the elevators which can at first be confusing - go up the 4th from the main lobby, cross the bridge, take another elevator to the 2nd, then walk farther down the corridor - too bad if your room is at the very end. Housekeeping staff in the corridors are sometimes very noisy with their conversations and laughter. They can be heard from inside our room. SUGGESTION: Most of the hotel staff should be given rigid training on good manners, and a proper and pleasant attitude in difficult circumstances. One hardly sees them smile - a very important factor in making guests feel welcome and more at home. They should remember that their salaries come from the hotel guests and not from their managers. BUT, in fairness, the following make up for the negative points: 1) the lobby is presentable and spacious enough (although with not enough seats). 2) there is a coffee shop right in the lobby for the really hungry. 3) a desk manned by very amiable tourist consultants is positioned in the lobby. 4) since it is a relatively new hotel, bathrooms are very clean with daily cleaning schedules and change of towels everyday with no need to request. 5) the male staff in red T-shirts assigned at the lobby to assist guests were quite friendly and helpful. But they don't bring your luggage for you up to your room...unless perhaps if you are carrying loads and loads of luggage. 6) hotel location in Little India is quite convenient and accessible for most tourists who love to walk around For tourists like us who are out of their rooms the whole day, there is no reason for us to pay 5-star rates. 3-star hotels should be good enough for sleeping and resting purposes during the night, so these hotels should try their best to make the guests most comfortable and pleased with the attitudes and services of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: VinodKTyagi
Reviews.Content: Rooms too small with bare minimum furnishing, room service;non existent at all, No drinking water, forget about tea and coffee. Breakfast very poor quality and same on all days highly diluted milk, juice and daal (lentil) with little verity. Worst of all is attitude of staff, rude and arrogant. They treat you like beggars. My credit card was blocked just to secure their not so high class linen and an electric cattle provided in the room. Since their rent was secured by the travel agent, it was strange and unprofessional to block credit card for room accessories. If you are from India, it is only the location of the hotel that is the sole positive factor in favor of this hotel (situated in Little India and surrounded by a number of Indian restaurants and shopping malls) , otherwise there is no point in choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy for comfortable stay at the tariff”
Reviews.Author: Kalyan1943
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small no proper facility. Breakfast spread was terrible. Not suitable for any star rating. No teabag, coffee etc is provided, only an electric kettle and cups are provided. No drinking water in the room. It is better to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Abaykaran J
Reviews.Content: hello everyone, i was here in this hotel for 2 nights & 3 days in November, basically this hotel is good, it looks good and the rooms were also okay, not bad. but the problem about this place is about the staff in this hotel, the rudest staffs i've seen so far in a star hotel. They look at u in a way like they're not bothered, and they do not help u out at all! specially when i came to check in, the reception staff are very bad, not friendly at all - the worst i've seen. even the bell boys are rude to you, 'very bad customer service' and they have an unusual check-in and check-out time which was a big problem for me and my family. but this place is located in a nice place, great place for shopping, because places like mustafa and city square and other big malls are closeby and a nice temple too.. BUT! im very very dissappointed with the behviour of the hotel staff.. not satisfied... i hope this will help your'll out.. have a great vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “A Night is More Than Enough !!!”
Reviews.Author: suri85
Reviews.Content: Thanks God I only stayed here for a night! The kindest word I could think of regarding this hotel is unusual. Where do I begin.... How about the out of the ordinary check in and breakfast times. There was a sign on the reception desk saying that the Check out time is 12 PM, Check in time is 3PM, and Breakfast time start from 7-10 AM. Probably I should ask why the unusual time because The room clearly did not reflect the three hours worth of efforts dedicated to it and it didn't seem to take that much time to prepare the breakfast buffet. The was room pretty much bare, no teas, no coffee, no drinking water, and limited channels on the tv. My Room had black smudges on the wall, and while talking about the wall, I could hear what my neighbours were talking and watching because the wall was quite thin. The Interior design is unusual, the bed and the shower is separated by a glass, Fortunately I stayed alone, so I didn't have the awkward instances where I was lying on the bed and I could see my room mate silhouettes in the shower. My room located in a different building than the reception, so I needed to take a lift to the 4th floor crossing the bridge, to access another lift and went down a floor (my room was in the 3rd floor), vice versa, so it was very annoying. My room was directly behind a Hindu temple so I could see the intricate detail of the temple and peeked on their worship. In the morning the temple rang a bell so you have a morning call (too bad if you want to sleep in) The breakfast... I think they had a contract with a caterer because there were no kitchen anywhere near the breakfast room (located on 8th floor of the reception building, so I needed to take a lift to the 4th floor, crossing the bridge, took the lft to 8th floor). The food range was limited, just bread, rice, curry, sausages, vege spring rolls, baked beans, fruit, tea, coffees n water; Only the water, rice and vege spring rolls were edible to me. The breakfast is small, I'm pretty sure if a quarter of the whole occupants of the hotel decided to have breakfast at the same time, some of them have to wait for a table; Well, there's a 7/11 right downstairs outside the lobby. Despite the negatives about the physical aspects of the hotel, the biggest problem was the staff. A housekeeping staff sat on the floor on the hallway of my floor, and reception and concierge staff were unhelpful. I have two specific examples of how unhelpful the concierge and reception staff were (In hindsight, I don't know whether they were unhelpful or unknowledgable). When I arrived at the hotel, I asked the concierge how to get to the MRT station and He told me it was better to take a taxi to my destination, but I decided to walk a little bit and I saw an MRT sign, after following the sign, I reached Little India MRT station. The second example was when I needed to change my SGD1000 bill into smaller currency. I asked the reception staff whether she could help me with that and she said they didn't have that much cash with them, Fair enough, but she said to me to try the numerous restaurants surrounding the hotel. I knew that was a bad suggestion so I tried several gold and jewellery stores on the Serangoon St, until I found the only money exchange stall that could help me. Thanks God, I checked out right after breakfast and straight to my conference, because I couldn't stand it anymore! A night is more than enough!

Reviews.Title: “Malaysia & Singapore visit”
Reviews.Author: PJMENON
Reviews.Content: Access wise it is a good hotel, also rooms are spacious.But the breakfast was not upto the mark.because there was no space for if 50% of the occupants come for brakfast at a time.There were long queue in each counter. But for a middle class people this is ok

Reviews.Title: “4* Hotel in little india singapore”
Reviews.Author: bafgm
Reviews.Content: Located in Little India, surrounded by variety of indian restaurants . Near to the temple. Good rooms with all amenities. Clean washrooms with all good quality toiletries. clean linen, well connected with city. Near to shoping centre and easily get transport system. Inhouse travel agent . check in time 3pm and if your flight arrival time is morning , you have to wait until 3pm . better take a room before the date of arrival. Breackfast is free and good for indian for their taste.Good transporation facilities. you can find number of shop owners are indian . you can get indian dresses , food , resturant, shops, hindi speaking people. safety environment . Late night no problem to coming the hotel. Hotel people are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with 4 star facility”
Reviews.Author: bossaravind
Reviews.Content: We satayed 3 days at grand chancellor, nice hotel & good sevice offered by them Very close to shopping center Like ( Mustafa , Sim Lim Square & city square mall ) &mrt transmit to the city For indians can have indian food close to the hotel Night life is very good at the place Mrt connection to the whole citys of singapore is close to the hotel Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: PHBhobe
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, food was OK. IN little India, so a good place for Indians looking for Indian food. Service was average. Only had breakfast here. For vegeterians, little choice - may need to live on bread, cereals and fruits. Non Veg spread was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Little India Singapore”
Reviews.Author: IssarS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 02 nights in this hotel in Sep 2011, The rooms are small but clean & good condition, They dont give water bottles in room, you can take from bathroom only (tap water is safe for drinking in Singapore). We came little late to have our breakfast, there was 5 min left for breakfast time, once we reached coffee shop, some lady told us not to entre, it was so embarasing, but someone came and asked us to go inside. Be sure you get two breakfast cards because they gives one room key with breakfast card (envalop type) only.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if there is no other better option”
Reviews.Author: Marimuthu Rames... S
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and my eleven year kid during the second week of october for three nights.At the time of check in itself we realised that we have come to a wrong place as the receptionist himself received us with absolutely negative interest. Later there was nobody to guide us to the room or even carry the baggages.We were alloted in the podium block for which we had to take a lift from one block to another and take another lift to reach the room without anyones help.Breakfast was offered for only two of us while three of us were staying.The funniest part is their roomkey process which one has to personally experience to realise their comical sense at the cost of our expenses and unwaranteed hardship. A special mention has to be given to the bell boy with red shirt, who thinks himself as a guest and treats us in his position. The hotel itself is a disgrace for Singapore hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Anoop M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for 2 nights. Its a nice hotel located in Little India. Very good food available for Vegetarian. There one temple also very near to the Hotel. Room are small but adequate space for living. Thanks Anoop

Reviews.Title: “Location only plus point.”
Reviews.Author: indian_on_a_roll
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and tidy. But the service staff are all horrible. They behave as if they are government employees. Seriously. There is no room service. You have to go down to the lobby to receive your guest as the elevator requires card key and they would not provide it to the guest. Anything you want, you'll have to step down to the reception to get it yourself. I wanted to use the wi fi and asked the reception to give the passkey over the intercom and debit the charge to my room. They would just not do it. Finally had go down to the reception, pay 6 Sing $ and get the passkey myself. The housekeeping would not provie a single extra towel. For an extra towel, they wanted to charge 6 $. Weird. Apart from the location and ease of access (for Indians) nothing good about the hotel. Stay at some other place if you want even a hint of service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Indian tourist”
Reviews.Author: Raj S
Reviews.Content: Overalll the hotel is good for following, Excellent location Plenty indian Restaurants around Hindu temple Room & location is worthable for $ And the worst part of this hotel, No hospitality Don't expect good room service Staff are not friendly except few senior staff, free breakfast Hall is very poor and so crowded the breakfast service is very poor try to avoid and you can get better food and service outside.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saswat66
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights, last week in their 3rd floor podium rooms @ 170 SGD per night. Since Formula 1 was on, could not find a better hotel than this. Its a strange hotel from the time we stepped in. After a long tokyo-singapore flight+ 45 minutes drive from airport, we were made to wait almost for 20 minutes to check in! We were asked to deposit 50 sgd per room towards Minibars, which, later found to be non-existent ! Room cards given to us were found to be in correct for the lift. Even after several attempts, the reception could not correct it!! Finally, after 45 minutes,we could reach our rooms through a security guys card!! The hotel has a very strange lift system, if you stay in the podium block rooms. The main lifts get very crowded at times due to faulty cards and strange connecting systems. Hotel staffs are almost non-existent and non co-operative, except the very efficient and help concierge guys in red and colorful travel desk guys. Podium rooms are ok with basics but far less than a USD130 per night hotel. No minibar for which we were asked to pay a deposit before! Room views are ok. The hotel is very popular with group tour operators from South Asia, as a results, common areas like reception, lobby, breakfast etc get crowded. Hotel offers a very basic complimentary breakfast with water down juice, tea and coffee between 07.30 to 09.30. at 09am, one needs to serious struggle for a piece of toast. Location wise, the hotel is fine, close to MRT, eateries and the famous Mustafa shopping. Unless you get a good bargain, better to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor choice”
Reviews.Author: pamela d
Reviews.Content: sorry to disagree but we had a free stop over with singapore airlines from brisbane to amsterdam last may 2011.the bed had a long black hair on the sheet as I turned it back and the pillow smelt strongly of perfume.I doubt if they had changed the sheets.As we have fair hair we new it wasnt ours.The breakfast was discusting for 34$ for p/p and we had yogurt and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve such poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: janali67
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a Singapore Airlines stopover. I cannot agree with any of the negative comments and imagine many were made by tourists who were not prepared to accept that in some places things are done differently. I am from the UK but have visited Singapore on numerous occasions. The hotel seemed perfectly adequate with attentive staff and a modern comfortable room. Our needs were fully catered for. If you are not happy with the food you can get in the hotel you are probably in the food capital of the world and would not have to travel any great distance to find something to your liking. My wife and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not advisable”
Reviews.Author: Raju M
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, wash rooms are with see through partitions No shower provided for WC, it's not acceptable for guests from Sub continet and middle east Same breakfast everyday Unfriendly staff, may be no motivation

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Singapore or maybe in this world!”
Reviews.Author: Sapna H
Reviews.Content: My friends & I went to Singapore this August (2011). It was a pleasure trip but worked on a tight budget. We knew the check in time was post 3pm, hence we requested the manger to keep our luggage in the storage while we do some sight seeing... this is when we faced the inhospitality of the hotel. The bell boy screams at us and tells us to lift our luggage and keep it in the storage room, as it was not his 'Job' do so. Post this incident several guests (Indians) came to us and complained that the staff was extremely rude to the guests. The lifts don't work. The food was horrible ( that was an understatement according to me). The bellboys refuse to deliver or pick the luggage. They don't give complimentary water (which we thought was the most basic thing as they gave complimentary Shampoo & Soap!!). The room service wont give plates as they do not allow outside food, even in the rooms!. and yes, before that when you call reception, it goes to room service, when call room service it goes to the operator....There was tea/coffee maker in the room but no water, tea bags, milk or sugar (more like a decoration piece!). The hallway carpet was full of dust...as if the whole of Singapore came here everyday to wipe off their shoes. The most shocking part was the day we checked out... my friend requested the reception executive to send someone to bring our luggage down to the lobby, (an hour before the check out time, which was 11 am). The Personnel said that all the bellboys were out for lunch and would be back by 2 pm ( 3hours long lunch time!! Awesome isnt it?)... so how do we get our luggage (7 bags to be precise)... he asked us to get one bag down at a time (5th floor to ground via a passage way which connect one building to the other... so from 5th floor u go to 4th then use the passageway to go to the other building take the lift from their to reach the reception... this was because the lifts weren't working for past one month or so...) My friend refused to do so, thats when this hotel representative shouted and asked her to shut up... do I need to say more??? The word hospitality doesn't seem to appear anywhere in this hotel's dictionary!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation just ok, location not great”
Reviews.Author: RachSan
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to staying here after all the bad reviews I had read, but it was part of Singapore airlines stopover so I didn't really have choice. We arrived here at 9am, it was not possible to pay for early check in so we had to wait until 3pm, there was a room to leave luggage locked up though which is good. Staff were ok, room was decent and we only had to pay $100SGD to get a 6pm check out. Location is not great, little India is very dirty and run down and if you don't like Indian food you will have to take MRT to somewhere nice like Orchard Road. If I were to go back to Singapore, on Orchard Road is where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there...”
Reviews.Author: Jrmodi
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff must understand that only building does not attract tourist but their behavior does. This hotel staff is very rude and think that we are staying there for free. They must take training for smiling. Bell boy think that he is a front desk staff and front desk staff thinks that they are the owner. Indians must stop going there because most of the Business they are getting from Indians and they Insult them most !!! Don't spoil your valuable money

Reviews.Title: “Very Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JayeshPandya
Reviews.Content: We a group of Eight (family+friends) stayed during 24/07/11 to 28/07/11. We had read certain negative reviews prior to booking this hotel but then we knew this was a new hotel (Started in the Year-2010) operated by international hotel chain so would certainly provide clean room+bathroom that u need so we booked FOUR Rooms w/o BF thru www.asiatravel.com, We got a great Room deal and our guess was 100% correct,the hotel offered very clean rooms+bathrooms. Room+Bathroom size is not large but not uncomfortable too for two guest especially if u wanted good room deal. Location is very ideal, choices of Indian restaurants at walking distance for hot breakfast+coffee, Mustafa 24 hrs.shopping+MRT (NE7) at walking distance as well. For two consecutive days we took MRT for travel to Sentosa, fast+Comfortable+economical. Clarke Quay very popular dining and tourist attraction on same MRT line.Indian temples around the hotel, fruits and other daily need market nearby so a better place to stay especially for Indian travellers+shopping lovers. Hotel should provide in the Room tea/coffee sachets along with tea/coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, near many Vegetarian restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: thehappyman
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay in Little India area, I was a bit skeptical when I stepped into the Lobby, I wondered if K actually booked the correct hotel. (Because I paid a lot lesser on the net). The Lobby looks grand but a bit like an airport, with the arrangements of the seats. The room is a bit small though but clean and new. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. No problems with any restaurants including the vegetarians. the staffs were ok, not that they look great in theri uniforms but they are quiet pleasant to me, eventhough they always seem very busy with other group guests. I do not mind going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic ,never stay”
Reviews.Author: Bobbby23
Reviews.Content: Never Ever stay in this cheap and disgusting hotel. although the location is good, rooms are decent and clean , the staff of the hotel is horrendous. No manners, no regard for guests and even ready to harass you every time you ask for anything. I asked for a Plat and a knife in my room, the person at the reception told me to wait for 30 minutes as he was busy . when i said i cant wait, he said then i cannot help you. They have a complete list of items with thier prices that you may be required to pay running into hundreds of dollars if you break anything or for that matter even if you misplace a towel . I would never every stay in this hotel even for free. The room walls are so thin that one can hear what the other person is doing in his room.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better options!”
Reviews.Author: joANDscott
Reviews.Content: The view was great and so was the pool, but that's about the only positive comments we have. The rooms were small but nice enough, though there was no control over the AC, it was either hot or cold. But the lobby, where everything was, felt more like an active bus station, with stacks of baggage everywhere, groups waiting in rows of seats, and lots of noise. Internet was very expensive and I had to sit in the hall to get a good connection. It's also a very noisy neighborhood, with loud motorcycles, temple bells ringing and mosque calls to prayer going off frequently. There HAS to be a better place to stay in Singapore for $220+ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless !”
Reviews.Author: dreamtraveller069
Reviews.Content: One of the wildest place ever I have stayed. Never ever think of going there. I just cant explain the kind of experience I have gone and seen happennig around with other guests. Every single review written here negatively is true about this hotel. The hotel staff treat you like prisoners and they are doing favour to us. They just dont bother whether you are a asian or other race or elderly person above 75. Please note I have seen this happening right from checkin process, breakfast quality, only one room key and lots more to say.... Please dont waste your money & precious time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: TineyWeenie
Reviews.Content: The walk in rate was S$220++ for the superior room but it's just like a budget hotel room so it's just not worth staying there unless there is no other hotel rooms available. The Receptionist is also rude & unhelpful. When I requested for a late checkout since I checked in late the day before, the Receptionist just told me to leave without giving me any other option if not he will imposed a half day rate charge. Then when I agreed to pay the half day charge and checked at 6pm as that is the usual half day checkout time, the Receptionist then told me that I still have to leave immediately eventhough payments have been done. Just unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Never Never Stay at this extremely unfriendly place”
Reviews.Author: Jagjeet_11
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Hotel I have ever stayed in . The staff is downright rude and not concerned about the guests . We saw guests being treated like cattle . Guests are made to wait for hours for the check in formalities and there is no seating space as there are other waiting guests on the limited seats in the reception area. Breakfast is of poor quality and the tables are not cleaned . Breakfast hall has limited capacity and there is a mad rush at the counters . We felt like prisoners standing in a queue to be served with watery daals and vegetables. Strongly advice against staying in this horrible lace.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there”
Reviews.Author: hitujain4u
Reviews.Content: I will never recommend any one going there. There is not lifts connecting to the floor directly. We have to go to another block and then change the lift to go to the room. The room is horrible. There is see though toilets. One of the worst designed interiors. I will never recommend any one going to such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly staff -otherwise good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bajrang
Reviews.Content: We were four couple on our first trip to Singapore although I have personally travelled a lot to this magnificent city. On arrival , we requested for at least one room before schduled check in time but we were kept waiting for almost an hour before rooms were given but on two different floors with very complicated security so that if we have to go to another room we needed to come to reception take security personnel and go to the other floor. Other things like food and room were very nice although staying in Little India on a Sunday as there are no taxis available and the place get very congested.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD, SERVICE STAFF WAS NOT CO-OPERATIVE”
Reviews.Author: deepak_nagar2002
Reviews.Content: i suggest you not to opt for this hotel very bad services all over and staff was very in co-operative with no prompt services with no water in room and room was very small with bathroom too very very small in size. No free services at all even internet, water etc was chargeable. Breakfast served was common all the days very bad and taste was like hell.

Reviews.Title: “A popular hotel among travelers from India”
Reviews.Author: mehtaman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a favorite of Indian travelers as it is located in Little India. Rooms - neat and clean. Ambience - good. Location - Very close to Serangoon Plaza, which is a favorite place for Indian shoppers. Also there are a lot of small shops( to buy souvenirs) nearby. Travel desk - Available Ample parking space. There is a temple right next to the hotel. The only complain I had was regarding the cutlery and crockery used. I had opted only for the breakfast so cannot comment on the food/cutlery/crockery during lunch/dinner. However the cutlery/crockery used during breakfast was not cleaned properly

Reviews.Title: “indians should prefer this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nirajgala
Reviews.Content: i had a stay in this hotel in april 2011. pls opt for the tower block instead of podium.tower block is much more peaceful.please do not opt for meal plan from hotels as lot of vegetarian, jain food is available at doorstep.the best part is the proximity from little india mrt station which makes travelling an ease in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the wrong place”
Reviews.Author: danecourt32
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK if you are from Asia but not if you are European. It is in the middle of Little India and as such not inviting for an evening stroll or if you are looking for somewhere to eat - unless you like indian food. Not within walking distance of anywhere nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, no cheap for what you get. Canteen hall breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: switchedoff
Reviews.Content: We booked here fairly late in the game (not through Agoda, our favorite site) b, paid $140 per night. I've stayed in two other hotels in Singapore since Sep 10, including a very cheap and cheerful basic hotel (under AUD$48!) in Geylang and one on Bencoolen (around $AUD100) in September. This hotel was not nearly as good value for money. Room much smaller, just room for twin beds (no this was not part of the deal, supposed to be a double room. With just enough room for one bedside cabinet. Beds were hard, pillows flat, and no spares either, only one pillow each. Provided basic toiletries, but whilst there was tea and coffee making facilities, there was not even a tea bag supplied! The fridge was empty. Breakfast was surreal. We stayed 10 minutes then escaped for a hawker market for a feed. The breakfast was "served" in a huge hall with big round banquet tables set with dirty plastic table cloths, and people came in and found spots where they could, all self serve. The coffee was undrinkable, the "singapore noodles" just noodles with not even veg. My husband nearly had a fit at the sight of the slabs of mass cooked eggs in the chafing dishes. It felt like a bus station. When we arrived the night staff could not be bothered, and we were friendly but could not raise a smile, no help with bags or anything. Suspect we were deliberately given the twin room (we are a middle aged married couple too!). I would have to say, stay somewhere else for that money, you can and will do much better. We did love Little India, however!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: npbatra
Reviews.Content: we group tour for singapore for 2 night stay 19 march to 21 march this hotel for free brakfast for good quality brakfast room good clean rooms , hotel near main market for(sarangoon road) singapore but 1 problum room check in time 2 pm

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night when my other hotel plans fell through--was recommended through the airport hotel booking. Desk staff were harried, but helpful. Room was clean, bathroom clean, good hot water supply. Location is not ideal--not close to anything but Little India. About 25 minutes from the airport. Great Indian food at many little places near-by.

Reviews.Title: “NO SERVICES, IMPOLITE PEOPLES, BAD BREAKFAST...”
Reviews.Author: ALIASUSERS
Reviews.Content: Please do not come in this hotel. A lot of client of this hotel are too much impolite. There is no services, the breakfast is really poor and happen in a "canteen room", there is no fruit juices, only "chemical liquid".

Reviews.Title: “room was vary small and bathroom was very bad - breakfast was poor”
Reviews.Author: GCSKanpur_India
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 14th to 16th December 2010, room allotted to me was not good, it was vary small and bathroom was partitioned with glass 2 foot above from floor. There was no facility to wash except paper when you go to fresh in morning. Dos;t suits to Indians.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay no one”
Reviews.Author: giri-aravalli
Reviews.Content: hi, This is giri from Hyderabad, india. we are 14members stayed for a 6 days trips from 12th january to 17th january in the Great Grand Chancellor. i could not describe about the hotel. the cleaness, food, location and the front desk people every thing is very bad. the lift is very slow. if the hotel people provides a staircase, we can come down fast. and dont speak about the breakfast. why they are giving the complementory breakfast. it has bread, jam, one variety of rice, cheap quality samosa and juice. the very first day our children vomited the juice by sipping only once. after that we have never tryed. so i request all the people dont stay in Grand chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOOK YOUR STAY HERE! It's horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymakers48
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at a hotel as bad as this before. The service is really, really bad. People at reception were casual, unhelpful and even scowled at us on arrival. At other times when we enquired about something, we were left waiting for some time. They don't smile and one receptionist looked as if she was 'scared' to ask what our needs were. She didn't seemed happy to be working there. We had a standard room and to get there, we were surprised we had to take the lift up to the 4th floor, walk across a bridge, take another lift down a level before arriving at our room. Quite a trek! And it's the only way in and out of the place. We were given a room directly behind the Hindu temple and the two days we stayed there, we were woken up VERY early in the morning by the prays, chanting and bells ring from the temple. It went on for quite awhile. So needless to say we didn't get much sleep the first night, after arriving at the hotel at 1am. This was repeated the next morning, so we were very annoyed! The walls/doors are not very sound proof and it can get very noisy. Luckily we only stayed 2 nights. I got cold during the first night, so the next day I asked for an extra blanket. Reception said they didn't have any to spare, but could offer me a sheet instead. However, it would cost me $10 for the hire.... I declined. Taxis didn't know where the hotel was situated and thus catching taxis from the place was near impossible. We had to ring up for one. So overall a bad experience for us. Unfriendly, unhelpful staff and it's very noisy. I would definitely not recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not secured”
Reviews.Author: cexssy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the cheapest I found in the internet so I booked it. I forgot to check the reviews then my friend just told me that there are a lot of negative reviews about Grand Chancellor, well, we can't do anyting but just to pursue with our booking. The driver who accompany us to the hotel warned us about the "danger" in Little India. We're quite afraid of the area. Oh well, the hotel's receptionists are friendly. But we notice that they don't have service so we have to get our requested stuffs in the lobby area. The room is quite small but it's clean. The bathroom has an average size. The hotel is not secure because they don't have any security personnel on each floor and even in the lobby, so I think even though your not a guest there, you can roam around the hotel anytime you want. Also, they don't have complimentary water, coffee, sugar, creamer, and tea. Which is really unusual. They charge extra towel, tootbrush, everything! Their restaurant service is really slow, according to the people who ordered so we did not pursue with ours. There are a lot of Indians talking as a group after midnight in the hotel corridor and some of the men are topless which is really scary especially if your a female approaching to your room alone. Of course the hotel is in Little India, if you're not a fan of Indian food, don't stay here. Well, the hotel has 711 beside it. Also the hotel is 5-min walk to MRT (Little India Station). Honestly, I really don't recommend this hotel, rate is really cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible ! A total disappointment !”
Reviews.Author: PTCC
Reviews.Content: I thought to give it a try since it is a new hotel and totally ignored the comments of this website. It is a total disappointment. The room smells and it looks like a budget hotel. There is no free bottled water, no coffee and tea - just sanitary bag, shower gel and shampoo. There is no proper cabinet and no safe. The small fridge on the floor gives out a clincking sound and you have to switch it off during the night. The bed is hard as rock and it smells. Eventhough the hotel is only 8 months old, it is dusty and has ants running around. The walls are thin and you can hear conversation next door. People could be heard walking on the corridors late at night into their rooms. Worst still, the rooms faces the indian temple right at the back and the bell rings round stop from 8.00 am for 15 mins. Prayers chanting starts early in the morning before sun rises. Staff are rude and are totally ignorant of you. Pathetic ! Outside the hotel, you can see Indians (foreign migrant workers) hanging on the streets like swarm of bees, some of them sitting by the road sides and junctions, some of them walking on the street itself ignoring traffic turning into the hotel. It really resembles INDIA and tourists from India will definitely feel at home here at this hotel - as plenty of Indian around the vicinity. It definitely not worth the price paying for this BUDGET hotel. Please avoid this hotel at all ! You would not have a good sleep. Definitely NOT ! I would not be coming back at all !

Reviews.Title: “Little india nice place”
Reviews.Author: nrj73
Reviews.Content: location if you want little india, then nice hotel if you book early, good stay we had for service it is very costly. better to do everything own.

Reviews.Title: “Budget price - fair/bad service”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel294229
Reviews.Content: Check-in took forever, no wonder they put 2 rows of seats next to the reception desk ( stayed on Oct 27 and Nov 16, 2010 ), i was asked to sit n wait there for about 15mins on both trips. Aint no guest around reception desk , i was wondering why the other 2 were doing nothing while the third receptionist busied and asked me to wait instead of being served by that other two. Anyway their services way below a star hotels, so get prepared to book>>pay>>sleep>>leave without a smile. Rooms are clean , except there are many dirty spots all around the "particle walls". No safety box in room, no free coffee n tea nor water botled. Cant complaint much, as their descendent the Grand Central hotel in Orchad, does give a similar kind of services.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service & Management !”
Reviews.Author: holidaysmaker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there with a group of 19 persons during Dipawali time on 11 November. The hotel was over crowded !!! The reception staff looked fraustated with the situation of fully booked hotel. Every day they are running short of food at breakfast restaurant ! They can not handle the situation when the hotel is fully booked. Needs to improve management.

Reviews.Title: “Why go to Mumbai when you can stay in sanitised Little India!”
Reviews.Author: Javacoffee
Reviews.Content: You know, I think it would be very hard to beat a S$110 night including breakfast in a chain hotel that is barely a year old. Rooms are small, granted, but fine for one/two people. They are tastefully decorated. All have internet access (pay). There is a small pool on level 8 and a breakfast room. Location for those wanting to go to Little India, Lim Sim square, Raffles Hospital or Bugis Junction...its outstanding. I would say the temple below can be a little noisy...some kind of indian trumpet starts at 6am...but its ok. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: phuketexpats
Reviews.Content: We were only staying for 1 night, so we booked this hotel as it was fairly new, close to Little India & the price was good. The service at reception was awful, it seemed no-one wanted to serve us & they did it under sufferance! The rooms are new but very small, and there is no safe for your valuables. There are 2 buildings in this hotel & most people (including us) seemed to be directed to the building across the street. This did not have good security, anyone could go up in the lift directly from the street. The hotel is very spartan, no creature comforts & we would not stay here again (even for one night). Pay a little bit more & stay somewhere like the Ibis, much better value. No wifi either.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: SindhuVietnam
Reviews.Content: Please do not believe any good references about this hotel, its JUST NOT TRUE!!! The reception staff to the bell boys ...all are extremely rude and PATHETIC in their behavior . They have LONG forgotten the basics of service. Tasteless Breakfast menu remains the same for days together and the quality of food is extremely poor ( coz its complimentary.....DILUTED ORANGE JUICE....WATERY TEA AND COFFEE ....the list is endless) . From the check in to check out all our interactions & experience with the staff have been much below standard. We had the opportunity to discuss this with several other guests whilst on common sightseeing trips and their experiences were similar or worse. This is actually a new hotel with good ambiance & meets the basic requirements. Who ever is the owner is just interested in making some fast money and has handed over the most critical responsibility to some fools.

Reviews.Title: “The most horrible experience of Singapore is living in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edusol
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Grand Chancellor, Singapore with my family during 12-16 October, 2010. Once I cheked in, I was asked to wait... after 20 mins again i approached Reception, he cooly says I hv to wait for 2 hours. Then I blasted him to give info'n properly. Then I paid S$30 for early chek in. Its ok but no body in reception is ready to lift their head and speak to customers. Building looks like 5 star hotel but once u get in it is horrible state. The rooms are so conjusted and just u can breath. Cleanliness is ok. The memories also carries how we stayed and where we stayed. We enjoyed and liked the whole Singapore luke and corner except this third class hotel. Really it was a nightmare. A person with Black color and White mustache, hefty person usually stands in reception during evening...aaah horrible... he thinks he is President of Singapore. Doesn't even like to speak to U. Crooks... I advise INDIANS like to visit Singapore should not go to this Hotel. Pl avoid this hotel. There are hundreds of other hotels which may be smaller in size but offers good stay and information and also good in behaviour. Another important is - there is a Travel Desk in the Hotel which cannot even call a local taxi for you. The lady says, u go to main road u will get taxi. Useless... I am a frequent traveller and also travelled to many destinations with family... but this is a most horrible experience of staying in this HOtel... Do not go to this hotel please... your pleasure of trip will be lost...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel although staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: ChanchalNidhi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in Little India, Newly constructed Building, Plus point for all the indians as you can enjoy Indian food all over the place. Mustafa Shopping centre is also just nearby. MRT Station is just 5 min. walk. Hotel has swimmming pool at 7 th Floor so one can enjoy there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very rude & inco-operative”
Reviews.Author: satayrojak
Reviews.Content: Room rates is nothing cheap I must said.. Market rate; but service was super lousy !! Hotel reception staff including duty manager was very rude & inco-operative ; not to mention friendly, they treat u as if u are some kind of prisoner ; not guest. House keeping is there for show only as u are not allow to ask for simple things like fresh towel or toilet paper ! Very strict control !! Come on we paid for this services & amenities; is not like we are going to bring them home but things like towel should be change upon guest request if it's soaking wet due to frequent shower. Not to mention also that it's not absorbent enough to dry the body .. Very restricted !! Everthing is chargeable including changing of 'TOWELs' !! MIND YOU & there is NO Written note anywhere to inform the guest . Staff just anyhow quote a price base on your request ! Bad service !!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean, but nothing more positive”
Reviews.Author: FamJoBe
Reviews.Content: I found this newbuilt Hotel on asiatravel.com. The price of 106S$ was really cheap for a Hotel in Singapore and we just needed a place to sleep. We stayed 3 nights in june and 2 nights in july on Grand Chancellor. The rooms are really small but clean. TV, refrigerator and kettle in room. The walls were so thin that you could here everything from the corridor. First stay we had a room on the 3rd floor facing the backyard. The traffic were so noisy that we had to use earplugs to get a sleep. The other stay we had a room on 5th floor facing the Hindu temple. The bells and music from the temple at praying time were noisy. The Hotel is still under construction so breakfast is served in a nearbye indian restaurant. Very poor breakfast. I recommend you not to pay extra for BF at the moment. The location is in the middle of Little India. Close to MRT Little India and Farrer Park. No Taxi driver could found the hotel, so I had to guide them at all time. The service is really poor from the Staff and they are really not guest friendly. This hotel is okey if you dont want to spend to much for a sleep, can take care of your self and doesn´t need assistans from the Hotel. Next time I probably pay a little bit more to get a quieter and more spacious room in a high class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “below average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mercuri2000
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny, everything is chargeable including drinkable water. (Reverse osmosis charging at 2SGD a pop) Mind you, they insists on a deposit of 50SGD even though the hotel is fully paid. The rooms that are currently used are the annex building and it's right smack next to the Hindu temple. The prayer din will start as early as 5am. Also notable is the rooms. All the walls are partitioned and it's so thin that anyone talking in the corridor or the next room can be heard pretty legibly. Internet access is chargeable for a minimum of 4 hours are 12 SGD. Pretty expensive considering u can access it in the shop 2 mins away from the hotel at 2 SGD an hour. One plus point is the walking distance to the MRT. It's near, around 5 mins walk away. There is also a beer garden around 100 metres away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very incooperative hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: biharrocks
Reviews.Content: v stayed in dis hotel coz it ws booked by our travel agent.there is no room service available.u cnt evn hv plain water,tea or coffee complimenttary in d hotel...n d hotel staff talk 2 u wid a lot of attitude.. totally nt worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “New but reasonable hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: virstud
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru FneTravel.com being new and with free roundtrip airport hotel transfer. The price is reasonable compared to other hotels in Singapore. locationwise, if you don't mind living with indians, is Ok since it is merely 5 minutes walk to the nearest MRT station. We arrived on Sunday, so we got the shock of our life to see hundreds of Indians loitering around the streets. But indians are very nice and freindly people. Lots of Indians foods and restaurants aroudn teh area. the hotel is in teh corner of Selangoor Road and the Mustafa center is merely 10 to 15 minutes walk. the Hotel is right behind the Indian temple. Toilet shower has no door, so water splashes all over the floor when you get into shower. No free wifi but who needs to pay wifi in Singapore? Just need to open the windows to be able to get signal for the free wifi in Singapore inside the room. Reception as mentioned on other reviews are not very friendly. the main door for the hotel is not equipped with sensor, the guards on duty needs to push a button for the door to open. The hotel is self rated as 3.5 star but, I would rate it as 2 stars only. This a new hotel so no complaints on the quality of bed and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK ONLY LAH..”
Reviews.Author: MAMBOBEAR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cheap compared to the others... Stayed there 3 times already because hotel price is dirt cheap.. However, in house manager not friendly, staffs are ok only.. Not advisable for long stay.. unless you enjoy being in an Indian district.. When requesting for rooms, ask for rooms not facing the temple because if there are prayers going on, you will be able to hear them.. Basic amenities in rooms.. electric jug with 2 mugs.. no coffee or tea or spoons.. Bathroom amenities.. shower gel, shampoo, shower cap, sanitary bag but no toothbrush.. Standing shower..

Reviews.Title: “Best location for indians!!!”
Reviews.Author: chirag81
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in the hotel for 3 nts. Very neat and clean hotel as i think it is newly openend. The rooms were clean and basic. Bathrooms also very clean with good basic fittings. The location of the hotel is very good if you are indian as u can find many indian restaurants at just a stone throw. The reception is not up to the mark. We have arrived 4 hours early to the check in time which is hopelessly 3 pm. And have to pay s$10 per hour for the early check in. This area can be very crowded during tthe weekends as all the tamils and bangladeshi working in singapore maybe the construction workers gather here in the little india during the evenings. while we came back from sentossa it was sunday evening , and were surprise to see the public on the streets. No place to walk at all. otherwise the hotel is good value for money as compared to other singapore budget hotels. Would definitly visit this hotel again if in singapore on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money- Comfortable location for South Indians”
Reviews.Author: karavindan2020
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Grand Chancellor for two days. The room is quite clean and comfortable, but small in size. Be aware, the refreshing drinks kept in the room are chargeable (including Water!). The hotel is conveniently located at Little India, Serangoon. It's one of the good location for South Indians. Traditional South Indian foods, shopping centres, Temples and Malls are nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Grand Chancellor Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Belilios Road, Singapore 219924, Singapore
